review_text:
I’ll start with the positives of living at State on Campus Bloomington. This is not a bad choice for your first place to live at when moving out of the dorms. I really enjoyed the location, amenities & staff members in the office. They do well with communicating unit entry, office closure and maintenance. Since they house a lot of students, there’s a good chance you’ll meet some really cool people. They also have students working the front desk so it’s nice to talk to people your own age. The property manager, Tabbitha, is extremely understanding and I had amazing conversations with her whether it was about the property or just things going on in my life. She really feels like a friend! I want to stress that my review has nothing to do with her skills as a property manager or her as a person (as well as any other of the wonderful staff members I had the pleasure of getting to know) as the issue I am about to describe did not seem to involve her at all but someone who works for/represents State that I have never seen at the physical location before.

Here’s my issue with State on Bloomington and why I cannot give it 5 stars. My roommate paid to have her room and part of the living room cleaned and still got charged a cleaning fee. In the agreement, there is a section that clearly states she did NOT have to “clean all areas of the apartment”. When we emailed corporate to ask about that fee, they said it “only covered her room and not the common area”. If that was the case, that should’ve been stated in the cleaning agreement. So not only did she pay $100 in cleaning fees, she was charged an additional $109 for “1/3 common area cleaning”.

On top of that, they’re charging us a total of $400 for repainting the walls. When we asked them to send pictures of damages that needed repaint, it’s like they didn’t even try to clean the walls first. While there were smudges (due to normal wear and tear) on the wall, it was clear that they took those pictures before cleaning. When I asked for a breakdown of paint and labor, and how it would cost $400, they told us that State needed to do a whole repaint on two of the walls. Let it also be known that we barely decorated the walls of that apartment so there were no holes or paint ripped off from tape.

As a college student, I do not have the time nor money to dispute these charges either legally or just between me and the apartment. I have already contacted State about this and do not wish to go back and forth again just for them to tell me I’m “wrong”. However, I do want to leave this review here for future residents so they are aware of the move out situation. Most of the reviews that have been written are by current residents who have not moved out yet. I also want to note that as a resident, you are incentivized to write reviews in exchange for gift cards or something related. While this does not guarantee good reviews, for a gift card I would definitely be quick to put five stars and a short note that doesn’t really sum up a full experience here as others have. You can really tell by reading some of these reviews. I’m sure this is not the first or only apartment to do this but I thought that was important to note.

All this to say: good place to live, be careful about the move out fees and TAKE PHOTOS OF EVERYTHING UPON MOVE-IN. They will take any chance to charge you for it if you don’t.

**EDIT**
They were able to change the price for my move out fee. Good response to my issues/complaint. I encourage others who have issues with State to continue communicating with them. Originally, I did not want to but I sent one last email in hopes of change. Clearly, it was worthwhile and I respect the staff for listening to my concerns and helping to rectify the issue.

We also ask that you not confuse rudeness for having to end a conversation that became hostile on your part as it was the third time the same concerns were addressed and not to your satisfaction, even your roommate had to ask you to stop. review_text: My daughter rented at this horrible complex. Please do not rent here. It is  terrible. We rented based on an apartment we were shown and when the girls showed up to take possession of the apartment it was an entirely different apartment with less living space. When we arrived for move in, the apartment was still a construction space and we had to wait on the sidewalk for hours until we were admitted. Once we were admitted, there was no thermostat.,The apartment did not have air conditioning for 18 days after move in and my daughter is an athlete and was unable to cool down after work outs.  Beyond that, there were holes all over the walls, water heater leaked, no back splash, shower had grout film all over the shower, doors do not latch properly, grout was on the floor and dried. The list goes on and on. Management was not receptive, in fact, they were rude and dismissive. I would never give these people another cent in the future! if I had know that I would be subjecting my child to these horrific conditions, I would have NEVER let her reside in a place such as this.

AC never work well. Extremely cold in one room and hot in the other room. Old dryer which took 2-3 hours to dry our clothes and no one fix that till now. They closed your maintenance request before they fixed the issue. A worker wrote disgusting word on my roommate's wall. FALSE ADVERTISING for a lot of things. Even no one clean the apartment before we moved in. We did all cleaning by ourselves. Very disappointed about how they treat their tenants.

Lived at Plato’s Court for 3 years and absolutely loved it! The price, the people, and the community really were the highlight of my college experience and all so close to campus! The staff Jada and Aman have been incredibly helpful this year for all my needs! Great place to live!
owner_answer: You’re too kind! We sincerely value your feedback and are so happy that you are enjoying living here at Plato's Court! Please let us know if there is anything we can do to improve your experience, and feel free to contact me at 812-334-2898. Have an awesome day!

review_text: I’ve been here since August and I’ve had the best experience so far. The roommates that I got placed with are great and Im happy to be renewing for another year!
owner_answer: Thanks for your feedback. We are grateful that you have chosen to call State on Campus Bloomington home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again! -Tabbitha Pitzer, Community Manager

review_text: Although we didn't get to use the amenities as much due to covid, this is definitely one of the better places I have lived in as a student in Bloomington. There weren't any major noise issues, the staff was very welcoming, the one unit apartments are nice (especially since they have central heating/air conditioning). Parking can potentially be an issue, but I would rather have quality apartments.
owner_answer: Thank you so much for the 5-star review! We are so glad to have you! -The Plato's Court Team

review_text: This is a great complex with wonderful management. I had an issue with my living situation and the manager, Erika, was very understanding and worked with me to place me in a new unit. The location and amenities of this complex are amazing for the price but keep in mind both entrances are hills and are city property so KL can't salt/plow those but they do a great job with the parking lot and sidewalks. I definitely recommend living here.

Honestly 2.5 stars is more appropriate but I'm nice. Review is long but organized by topic. Enjoy my honesty

OVERVIEW: We lived in a 3bd/2bath 900sqft apartment and honestly, it was small. If the three of us (total strangers upon move-in) didn't get along, I cannot imagine if we would've survived the year. There was little privacy so having friends over basically forced everyone else into their rooms. Small space with all hard floors made it rather loud and reverberant as well. The provided furniture was nice HOWEVER the lease said we would get dressers and we did not. That was the first of many lies told to us by management. We paid $505/month before insurance and electric bill. Since we moved out, I believe rent is over $550/month.

PARKING: They require you to buy a parking pass...fine....but the parking passes are done by calendar year (Jan-Dec) not academic year (Jul-Jun). All of their residents are student.....they only lease to students. This means that we paid $40 in the fall and had to buy another $40 parking pass in January. Additionally, because they keep adding bedrooms, there is a parking shortage so there is no guarantee you'll get a pass. Residents always park in the visitor spots so don't try to invite people over either.

KITCHEN: The kitchen was the best feature of the apartment although glass cooktops are a pain to keep clean. As are pure white countertops. Cannot keep it clean to save our lives. Cabinet space was sparse so we had to buy a large metal shelving unit for food storage. Appliance were wonderful and, at the price we paid (rates have since dramatically increased), it was a steal.

INSULATION/HEAT/AC: This place was freezing and wildly inefficient. The windows could not be made of thinner glass and the walls probably have half the insulation they really need. The air handler is located in a bedroom closet so whoever sleeps there (me) has a constant hum in the winter. Also, if you don't keep that cabinet door closed, it was actually quite loud. If you live on a bottom unit, perhaps you should buy your upstairs neighbors some nice slippers so you can't hear their every step.

LAUNDRY: (in-unit) I hated the laundry set up. Due to the location of the machine and the apartment acoustics, if anyone was doing laundry, don't try and watch tv or have a conversation.

<3 MAINTENANCE MAN <3 : This man is why we are giving it 3 stars instead of 2.  We don't know his name, but he is the only quality human employed by the leasing office. Nicest guy. Always pleasant. Prompt. Once we put in a maintenance request for a quick fix. He showed up and, upon noticing other little issues, went back to the office for more supplies and fixed two other things without being asked. Consistently went above and beyond in his work. I would see him picking up trash in the mornings. We love Maintenance Man

MANAGEMENT: Um well they were annoying and disorganized and didn't respect the tenants. We were pawns in their establishment not residents. They lied/omitted information a lot: we never got a gym; we went most of the year without proper blinds but were never told if/when we would get them; don't rely on them to email you if you get a package.
Over the summer, they renovated units but didn't warn the residents still living there. I personally endured consecutive days of hearing jack hammers in every unit around me. It was unbearably loud.
When one roommate moved out for the summer, she re-leased it. However, office being discombobulated, they repeatedly left eviction notices for her even though she signed papers to re-lease and didn't even live there anymore.

I love living here! Although the layout of my particular apartment was a bit different than expected, my roommates and I adjusted fine. We love the girls in the leasing office because they are so quick to help us with anything we need! They always have fun events to get the residents involved. Also a great location for IU students!!

I lived here about 2 years ago with a roommate and came back when I decided to finish my final year of undergrad by myself. The apartment was perfect for a first apartment by myself. There were a couple times I needed help with something quickly, once after the office had already closed but I had just happened to get ahold of somebody and they went so far out of their way to get everything taken care of for me, which meant so much considering my last apartment (between times living here) didn’t give a care about their tenants or the quality of their apartments they leased out. My apartment was so nice and I never had any issues within the apartment as far as living conditions. They only thing I would complain about is that some of other pet owners in the complex are absolutely horrible about picking up after their dogs, but obviously that is at fault of those tenants who aren’t responsible enough to take on that smelly part of owning an animal, not the complex staff. When I did talk to the office about it they began looking out more for tenants who weren’t following the pet waste policy and leaving notes with pet waste baggies on their doors to remind them to pick up after their pets. The office staff were always so happy and upbeat when I came in, and if you’re lucky you’ll get some puppy love from one of their dogs when she comes in to work with one of the girls :)
owner_answer: Thank you for your kind words, Sam! We appreciate you! It’s bittersweet watching our residents come and go. Go live your best life with great adventures!

review_text: Been living at Knight's Landing since Fall 2017, and have seen a lot of downgrades with the change in ownership. The staff has always been incredibly friendly and puts on events frequently (usually involving free food and stuff so that's always fun). The only utilities you have to pay is electricity, but you are forced to buy through Duke Energy, which I'm convinced artificially inflates the price, usually ends up at about $130/month and worse in winter. In terms of the actual apartments the two bedrooms were very spacious for the price, even though they weren't the most modern. Now they're renovating all of those 2 bedrooms into 3 bedrooms and are charging over $100 more/month for them! The new apartments are modern and have to be furnished, but now what choice does that leave current residents who can't afford that new price and already have a bunch of furniture? The complex is in the middle of being gentrified, forcing residents to pay up or move out next May. Hard to ethically support a place that screws over its clients like that.
owner_answer:
Hi Abigail,
Thank you for your review and your kind words about the staff and our efforts. Trust me we have our own concerns with Duke Energy at times, just as the residents pay their unit electric we pay common area lights and track the fluctuation which we have called many times about but that doesn’t just occur here. As a home owner with Duke I can tell you everyone with Duke experiences what you have but they have the monopoly as the only option for electric services.
We completely understand the concerns for changes, we were unsure at first but after seeing the upgrades to the space and the furniture packages, the price difference is low for what is being offered, not only inside the apartment but also the soon to come community upgrades, especially the two level fitness center. I am sure if you called around and compared the new rates per square foot and the rates of various properties per square foot you will find we are still very competitive and come in lower per sq feet plus when you add in the location to the stadium and the property amenities.
Again the changes may not be positive for all and we can empathize with that but we have had a record renewal year and are pre-leased 16% higher right now than last year at this time so the offerings, upgrades and even pricing is appealing to many current and future residents living preferences and that is what we want to make sure we are able to do, offer modern apartments as well as remaining competitive in the market.
We hope you stop by for our next event where we will be grilling and hopefully for our opening pool party in May where we will have BBQ.
Knights Landing Staff

review_text: I LOVEEEEE living here! I came to town late for this past Spring semester and although they were full, I went through their releasing process and am living in one of their 1 bedroom options. The floor plan is updated, the hammock garden is my favorite place especially during the most current weather conditions, and the pool is opening soon. I am so excited to spend the summer and the next year here. Their three bedroom renovations are BEAUTIFUL and if I had roommates in mind I would have definitely signed for one. They do have roommate matching but I graduated recently. My dog Coraline loves the bark park here! I am so glad I found this gem :)

NEVER BE AN IDIOT CHOOSE HERE!!!!!!!!

My girlfriend visited their newly renovated 3 bedroom model two months ago. The model was nice, like the pictures they posted.  They promised her new apartment will look exactly the same like the model. Every furniture, appliances, washer& dryer would be brand new!

Well, after she moved in, please just look at the pictures my gf sent to me. (Update: I uploaded 8 photos but I do not know why it is only showing 2 of them). No more words needed. They insisted this is “livable”. Are you kidding me? Man, I’m not paying that amount of rent for a “livable” place!

Worst place and management I’ve ever seen. More reviews and pictures coming up soon while I visit her this weekend.

-----------------

Some updates until now: it’s been a week since the move-in date. NOTHING has changed!!!! No blinds or curtains in every window so you are completely exposed to outside. Broken washer and dryer. Shower drainer stuck. No doors on closet. Bathroom in mess. Internet not working.

Extremely upset after finding out that “the company policy” does not prorate for residents moving out. This apartment complex is a complete waste of money, time and experience. They shortened our lease to 10 months and will not prorate for the 2 weeks we have left. I would never recommend this place to my worse enemy. Our apartment has had so many issues and I cannot count them on one hand.

This place will suck every penny from you possible so they can cut the dog park in half and build a playground that no one will ever use.

If you are a student reading this review, stay away and find an apartment closer to campus.
owner_answer: Ms Thompson, thank you for your review, which I will help clear up. Our office would be happy to send you a copy of your signed lease that states you signed for an early move out, or 10 month lease, as well as the full amount of rent. I’m sorry that you are upset about improving the dog park, which now has playground equipment for our resident pets, as well as our new outdoor CrossFit area. review_text: Talk about an amazing place to live. The ladies in the office are always so helpful and nice, and our family loves them and our maintenance guys! Today the ladies in the office teamed up with the maintenance guys and surprised our son with a swing of his very own right in front of our apartment! He was overjoyed, and it meant a lot to us as we don't have a playground or large yard for him to play in, this was the most amazing, sweetest surprise, and totally representative of how sweet the management and employees here at Knight's Landing are :)

Very poor management.  They seem nice and treat you well at the office, but they don't care at all about you.  They'll charge you for everything can can, including even a parking fee even though the lot is never more than 2/3 full.  We got flees in our apartment and they refused to help us get an exterminator until after our lease ended. We had to go out and find our own and pay for it.  After that, they got their own exterminator and then charged us for it even though we had moved out by that point.  Just a super crappy complex, do not live there.
owner_answer:

We do charge for damages done by past residents and expect them to be good care takers of the unit. As you said you had fleas but didn’t report them until one week prior to move out. Our vendor was unable to come prior to your move out as we told you and as you did not want to take fleas to your new apartment you made the choice to have extermination done. If you have any other questions please reach out.
Thank You

review_text: The price is inexpensive for how nice the apartments are (newly renovated!). The apartments are spacious and the staff is very friendly/helpful. The amenities are great, the grounds are kept clean, and it’s within walking distance of the stadium! I would definitely recommend Plato’s Court to anyone looking for an apartment!!
The guild did a very good job explaining and asking any questions we had. I loved how genuine and helpful Mrs. Pitzer was.
owner_answer: Thanks for your feedback. We are grateful that you have chosen to call State on Campus Bloomington home and are thankful to have you as a resident! Thanks again! -Tabbitha Pitzer, Community Manager

review_text:
Just no....my sister lives here and I wouldn't live here if you paid me. I couldn't even park when I tried to visit my sister. review_text:
DO NOT LIVE HERE!!!!
Management is horrible at taking care of renters. They false advertise what you will be given and then you are put in a broken down apartments no where near close of what they showed you. They have hidden fees that you don't find out about until the end of your lease and your stuck paying almost one extra month of rent worth of fixing to a already broken down apartment. owner_answer:

We want everyone to enjoy their time living at Knights Landing and are happy to discuss any issues that would prohibit them from doing so. Feel free to reach out to the office to discuss further if you have any questions.

review_text: Management here is not that great. I understand they try and help, but their help isn’t in a timely manner. Maintenance here is not organized at all. My dad had to write a strongly worded email just to get our washer a dryer replaced after 4 weeks of going back and forth with management. Then, they finally replaced it. Next, our dishwasher decided it didn’t want to run anymore so we put in a maintenance request. This time, the maintenance guy came the next day and said he would be back tomorrow to replace it. He never showed. A week went by and he never came. My roommate and I called the office to say we put in a request and it was never fixed. They told us that they don’t deal with that and that we have to put in another request, so we did. A week and a half went by and no one came to replace it still. It is now week 4 and I called on saturday to ask what was taking so long. they said they would text him and to have him come first thing monday morning. There was no show so I called them again. I was told yet again to put in another request. So I did. Although they keep stating that they don’t deal with it, they don’t put in much effort to make this happen quickly. I would not recommend signing here, as I will never again. Go somewhere that will fix your issues with the apartment faster. That, or they need to hire more maintenance people so tenants can be satisfied and that they can compete jobs in a timely manner. Indiana Law states that apartments must have appliances in good and working condition that encourages us to sign a lease. However, this is certainly not true here. On top of that, the pictures on the website are false advertising. We don’t have a workout place with equipment. The apartment complex is also not white on the outside. It needs to be stated somewhere that it’s not quite there yet. They also need to give tenants a timeline so we can know when to expect a gym. I signed my lease this year thinking there was going to be a gym with treadmills as it showed in the picture. It is still not built and was quite disappointing.

Absolute terrible place to live. A complete scam. Parking permit rates went from yearly passes, to semester passes, and increased in price from $30/year to $40/semester. The management seems nice and helpful, but it is a ploy to get you to sign here.  They do not prorate, and leases almost never start and end on the first of the month (when they expect rent). So, if you move in on the 12th of whatever month, you still have to pay for the entire month even though you will only be living there for about half of the month.

And the same goes for moving out. My move out day is the 11th of the month, and they are making me pay for the entire month regardless of having paid for a full month when I moved in, and regardless of me actually being in the apartment for less than half of the month. So, basically they expect an EXTRA full month's rent outside of the time that you will actually be staying in the apartment. And ending the lease earlier on the 1st of the month is obviously not an option, as they will charge a $600 lease-breaking fee.

They have recently updated a lot of things, like turning the two-bed into 3-beds, decreasing the size of the dog park to make room for an adult-like jungle-gym that is never used, and other cosmetic things that hardly help the community. They added an extra person to each of the two-bed to 3-bed converts, raised the prices for each room, and did not bother to add space to any of these units, or extra parking for the additional people expected to be living on the property. This place is an absolute scam. Also, they are BIG on towing, and visitors parking, and non-permit parking is far and few between after 6-7 P.M.

This place sucks for what they try to make you pay. Please DO NOT SIGN HERE.

Also, read all the responses to some of the reviews posted here. As you can see, often the management person replying to some of these reviews gets a little snappy defending the property, and these are instances to take into consideration. And another thing to consider, some people who are living here, and say that they "LOOOOOVE it!" are often people who have come in AFTER some of the renovations and price inflations, so they do not know that they are being scammed. Some people are fine paying more for mediocrity, but as someone who supports herself financially, I refuse to get less than what I am paying for by staying another year.

Something I find funny about this place is that, as a resident of about 3 three years, the first time i renewed I was able to do another year lease, which is ideal as a college student. However, this last time I renewed my lease, I was only allowed to do so and keep my same unit (and rental rate) if I signed a 10 month lease as opposed to a 12. This means that I have to be moved out of my apartment just a week after graduation, which sucks time wise. Being that there is predominantly college students living on this property, you would think that this is something they would take into consideration.

I was told that I had to sign a 10-month lease because the following year (2019-2020) there would be NO MORE 2-bed units. But guess what?! Just a couple weeks ago, I get a notice on my door, asking me to extend my lease from May to the end of July--what would have originally been the end of my lease, had they not been so eager to get rid of the people who KNOW what they old prices were BEFORE they started "upgrading" (more like down-grading) everything. Honestly none of the "upgrades" they have done are worth the inflation.

AN ABSOLUTE TERRIBLE PLACE TO LIVE (if your mom and dad aren't paying for everything)
owner_answer: Hello, Congrats on graduating! I’m sorry that in your 3 years that you were a resident, your rental rates went up. I assure you that if you call any area apartment, you would find the same thing, as rates increase. You would also find our parking to be cheaper, especially being located so close to the stadium, and rental prices being lower than area comps.  As for your lease, if you chose to release, the fee is not $600, and is clearly outlined in your signed lease, as well as the amount for the full months rent. The addition of our outdoor CrossFit gym  has been well received by other residents and visitors to our community. We wish you the best.

review_text: Where to start... we were told we couldn’t move in until August 21st due to renovations taking place (okay, understood); however, when we move in, there are still countless flaws to the apartment. Broken locks on windows that can’t be properly opened/closed (not to mention this is a legal safety issue that’s required to be taken care of), dryer backed up causing electric to be unnecessarily higher in cost, nicks all over the walls, holes not properly puttied in, and construction workers ear plugs and cig butts left throughout (I mean, seriously???). All of these have been documented and turned into the office but nothing has been fixed. Also, parking space is not accounted for regarding the amount of tenants this place harbors annually. A seriously unmet expectation!
owner_answer: Hi Cayli, the only service request we have under work orders for your unit is from 10/1, where the ac compressor stopped working, and the ac unit has since been replaced. Then charge $300 a pass! Lived here in Bloomington at 4 different apartments and never had to worry about paying for a pass let alone just getting a parking spot. Thats just what tipped the bucket this is easily the worst place I have ever lived. Waste of money.
Great place to live. They fixed our dryer within 24 hours of it being broken. The staff is very friendly and nice. They always email you with updates and reminders.
owner_answer: Thank you so much for the 5-star review! We are so glad to have you! -The Plato's Court Team

review_text: This is a wonderful property, the office staff is extremely helpful and always greets me with a smile. They even have a Courtesy Suite that my parents rent whenever they come to town to visit me! I will definitely be renewing to stay here at least another year.

Office staff extremely rude. Have laundry machines stacked in gym so the basketball area cannot be used. Taking advantage of “social distancing” to cut corners. review_text:
Edited to respond to comments from management:
“In regards to the pest issue we have advised you before that so long as your trash bags are taken out regularly rather than being left in the apartment kitchen and closet for a long time that you will not continue to have this issue with gnats and ants.”

As I never received any response about the ants and gnats I’m not sure who you told this to. However, trash has never been the issue. The kitchen and living area, which are the only places food is present in my apartment, are the only places there has not been an ant problem.
As I said, ants come through the wall separating my apartment from the adjacent unit. I have watched the ants come under the wall between the bathtub and toilet. Ants also come in through the wall in the bedroom where I also do not store or eat food or leave food waste. I regularly vacuum and clean the floor. I do have a trashcan in my bathroom which I empty regularly, as I do with the trash in the kitchen. I have never in my life kept trash in the closet.
When I moved in there was a cloud of gnats in the apartment which I took care of along with the other health and cleanliness issues present at move in.
I was out of the country for the summer so before I left I took the trash out and everything was clean and bug free. When I returned, there were gnats and ants again. As my apartment was empty the entire summer, there was still no trash present upon my return. So, in the absence of myself, food, or trash, the pest issue reappeared.
In regards to your smoke detector battery, maintenance provided you a battery free of charge so that your smoke detector would work then.”

Yes this was explained by the staff member in May. What is problematic is that when maintenance was sent months later, he said he was there to replace a battery that I had requested. This request was in May, so that was either a big delay in response or miscommunication, both of which have been cornerstones of my experiences as a resident.
ORIGINAL REVIEW:
The wifi is terrible; at times it does not work at all. It's pretty dirty and they cater primarily to pets. Not people. The office is the only place to get packages and they have very limited hours. If you have classes or work during the day you will have to skip to get your package because they only hold the package for around 5 days. They are also not open at all on weekends. So if you were planning to have things delivered Saturday it won't happen. The apartments are very poorly constructed too. It's very overpriced for cheap materials and shoddy construction. The counters are separating from the wall because the sealant was so poorly done. In the kitchen and bathroom. There is also a problem with ants and gnats. I notified the apartment that ants were coming in through the bathroom wall from the apartment behind and nothing was done about it. I had to handle it. I also had to handle many other problems when I moved in, the highlights of which include thick coats of dust on all the ceiling and wall vents which indicates there's probably some type of circulation problem, mold behind the washing machine, muddy water coming up from the bathtub drain, and an army of gnats. The response time is like that for a lot of things. For example, there was an inspection in May where they found my smoke detector alarm wasn't working. One of the maintenance men gave me a new battery, but the management wasn't aware of this. A week or two prior to the next inspection, which was in August or September, someone came saying there was a report I needed a battery for my smoke detector. This is how most issues are handled here.
owner_answer:
Hello Ms Solkey,
Please allow us to address your concerns. The internet has been upgraded as of 9/14/16 and you would have had a letter in the mail about picking up a new modem which will increase upload and download speeds. I lived here for a year and it was FAR too long. I'll write this in list form to better organize everything.

1. Campus Court advertises free TV and Internet (included in your rent). It was one of the things that made me decide to live here. I moved in right after the school year ended and lived there over the summer (when it was basically deserted because it is mainly student housing). When I first moved in, the internet was spotty at best, but it worked outside of high-traffic times when everyone was on. However, once school started up and everyone moved back in, the internet did not work. At all. Ever. This is completely false advertising on Campus Court's part. DO NOT fall into this trap. I had to get my own internet outside of the (already overpriced) rent.

2. The cable that came with the apartment was decent. The only complaint that I have is that the cable jack that was in the wall did not work. Therefore, I had to have Comcast come out to my apartment to set up the cable. Campus Court said that it should be good to go after you pick up the box from Comcast and plug it into the wall. Wrong. So when the guy came out to set up the TV, he said that at least half of the jacks in the walls at CC don't work and that his only option was to run the cable all the way across the living room and hallway to plug the cable into the jack that was located in the coat closet. I lived in a unit with hardwood floors, so the cable couldn't be hidden. It also had to cross a hallway and was a HUGE safety hazard/fall risk. I don't know how many times people fell over that cable. When I went to management they said that they wouldn't fix the problem. That was it- discussion closed. Next thing I knew, I received a bill for $100 from Comcast for the site visit that was needed to set up my cable. Even though it was Campus Court's fault that I needed a technician to come anyway, they refused to pay the bill.

3. I lived on the upper floor at Campus Court. The stairs to the apartment were falling apart. Every time someone would walk up, the set of stairs would shake to the point that I was afraid that the entire thing was going to fall over. On top of this, several of the boards in my stairs were starting to crack in half. I went to management to see what could be done. They said they would get the stairs fixed. Months later, nothing had been done. One day I was on my way down and the board on the step cracked in half. I fell all the way down the stairs. I immediately went to the office, and they had their handyman replace the one board that broke- even though there were several that needed it.  This was an ongoing battle that I never won. However, I have to say that the maintenance crew here is comprised of two of the nicest men I've met. They are awesome.

4. Finally, when I moved out, my room mate and I forgot about $500 worth of winter coats in the coat closet. We didn't realize until about 2 months after we moved out, as we moved out at the beginning of summer. I called Campus Court to inquire if they had been found and was completely stonewalled. The man that answered the phone said he would "ask around" and get back to me. I still hadn't heard anything a week later, so I called back. The woman that answered the phone this time said that per the lease, I had one month to pick up any forgotten items. Campus Court had ALL of my information including my phone number and forwarding address. But they certainly did not have the decency to give me a call saying I had forgotten everything that was in my coat closet. Instead, they let time run out of time so that someone could take it home without giving me the chance to reclaim my things.

For the location, the rent was ridiculously high. The staff were not helpful and were often exceedingly rude. You can find an apartment in a much better location for a better price.

review_text:
Apartment hunting had been really stressful, and we scheduled multiple visits to different properties on the same day in order to look around, however the Standard really stood out.

First off, I was able to schedule to view the Standard’s sample room which was staged at the leasing office. My mom and I went, and were feeling very discouraged due to the experience at the previous property we had checked out, but right when we entered we knew it was going to get better.

Right when we entered the room, I was greeted by name and was offered to see a virtual fly through of the property and get some questions answered. We asked all the questions we could think of at the time, and were even offered answers to questions we hadn’t even thought of at the time.

We looked around the staged room and it was very spacious and inviting. All the appliances were brand new and we even found out the fridge in the staging office is actually getting an upgrade in the actual units.

We left feeling hopeful but still had more properties to look at, so we left, however at the end of the day we knew we wanted to apply at the standard. I texted and asked about returning to the leasing office the following day to finalize a few questions we had and they were able to get us in.

We entered again and started to ask more questions, and ended up filling out the lease that day.

They were able to get a parkingspot added to my lease very easily, and that is a huge bonus as around campus parking is hard to come by.

With the building being built on 14th street it is a 10 minute walk from Kelly, and 10th street so Its very convenient even to walk down there,
Though we were told there will also be a bus stop for the standard as well.

Its definitely worth renting here, with how on top of everything they are I’m looking forward to living there next year.

review_text: Avoid living here at all costs. The other reviews here have to be fake, as living here is an absolute nightmare. It is an active construction zone, meaning you will be woken up at 7am daily to the noise of construction. The wifi is down constantly and it is a dead zone for cell service making it impossible to do homework in your own home. The units look nice but the construction is rushed and shoddy. For example my unit has holes in the floor and walls which led to an ant infestation. Management took over 2 weeks to respond to repeated emails and emergency maintenance requests about this and by the time they responded I had already spent $200 on my own pest control services. Currently my washing machine has been broken for the past 10 days and management has no response. Do not expect any maintenance at all. There’s always trash everywhere from residents and construction workers alike and many things are broken due to the poor quality of construction. Rent here is not worth the high cost and the management team is composed of nice but ultimately absolutely useless individuals who do nothing to solve the constant problems. The location is excellent and amenities are nice, but take your money elsewhere if you want a stress free living experience.

Should be individual lockers opening each resident to his or her own package. Lastly, people here need to respect their neighbors and quiet down past 1-2am. 1. They shut down our year-round hot tub and closed off all our outside amenities. We explicitly moved from Verve with the guarantee that the hot tub would be year-round. We pay a lot of money in rent for the amenities. We want to use them.

5. Male maintenance man came into our apartment and woke up female residents. This is inappropriate and a safety concern. No woman wants to wake up to a strange man outside their door. Just because you sent a notice saying this is going to happen in a span of four days does not prepare residents for this. Give a specific time on a specific day so residents can be prepared. If I was a parent, I would not want my daughter to live somewhere where this happens without adequate notice.
6. It frequently smells terrible in the hallways.
7. The package system is a disaster. I never get notified when my packages come. Therefore, it is hard for me to get my packages. I have had many missing packages. Everything about the package system is a headache.
8. Any problem is run through a third party. It is hard to ever get help.
9. Whenever we make suggestions or complaints, we are met with an unfriendly response. I am extremely disappointed with management here.
